learningContent.title: Testing the DITA Open Toolkit installation

lcInstruction.p: Now that you have installed the DITA Open Toolkit and the required JAVA Development Kit and set up your folder structure, you're ready to run your first test build. Follow the instructions below to generate a sample PDF file using the DITA OT. Separate instructions are provided for PC and Mac users.
lcInstruction.note: These instructions only apply to 2.x versions of the DITA Open Toolkit.

task.title: Running a DITA OT test build on a PC

step.cmd: Type cd to navigate to the OT folder.
Type the following string of commands into the command window to run the DITA OT:

info.note: To enter the filepath for the m_ducks.ditamap file without typing it, navigate to the file on your system, click on the file's icon, and drag the icon directly into the command window. You can use the same action to enter the filepath for the m_ducks_output folder without typing it.

step.cmd: Press ENTER to run the DITA Open Toolkit.
step.info: You will see a log of the DITA OT's build process in realtime displayed in the command window.

step.cmd: Look in the m_ducks_output folder to see your generated output. You should see a file called m_ducks.pdf.

task.title: Running a DITA OT test build on a Mac

step.cmd: Type cd to navigate to the OT folder.
Type the following string of commands into the Terminal to run the DITA OT:

info.note: To enter the filepath for the m_ducks.ditamap file without typing it, navigate to the file on your system, click on the file's icon, and drag the icon directly into the Terminal window. You can use the same action to enter the filepath for the m_ducks_output folder without typing it.

step.cmd: Press RETURN to run the DITA Open Toolkit.
step.info: You will see a log of the DITA OT's build process in realtime displayed in the Terminal.
